data.title: What Companies Does Dell Own?
data.meta_description: Discover the portfolio of companies owned by Dell, including VMware, Quest Software, RSA Security LLC, Denali Intermediate, Inc., NBT Bancorp Incorporated and Force10 Networks.
data.text:
Company Highlights:

VMware is a software company providing cloud and virtualization services that powers complex digital infrastructure. The company accelerates digital transformation by enabling unprecedented freedom and flexibility in how its customers build and evolve IT environments. Its software helps business users simply and securely access the apps and data they need, from anywhere, to do their best work. The company's software spans compute, cloud, networking and security, and digital workspace. VMware was founded in 1998 and is based in Palo Alto, California.

Show More

Company Highlights:

Quest Software, now a part of Dell, is a developer of windows management, application management, virtualization management, and database management software. They are a global provider to 130,000 companies across 100 countries, including 95% of the Fortune 500 and 90% of the Global 1000. So they have the experience to help them manage and protect their data, take control of their hybrid environments, keep track of all network-connected devices, stay compliant and govern every identity across the enterprise.

Show More

Company Highlights:

Legato Systems engages in the development, marketing, and support of storage software products and services worldwide. The company's solutions protect and manage information, assure the availability of applications, and provide access to business-critical information in distributed open systems environments. Legato Systems, Inc. software products and services are used in information protection and recovery, hierarchal storage management, automated availability, email, and content management purposes. It sells its products and services through various channels, including direct sales, value added resellers, system integrators, distributors, and original equipment manufacturers. Legato Systems, Inc. was founded in 1988 and is based in Mountain View, California.

Show More

Company Highlights:

ASAP Software Express, Inc. distributes personal computer software. The company also offers Dell software and hardware solutions, as well as allows customers to purchase software solutions online. It serves home and small offices; and federal government, state and local government, healthcare, higher education, and K-12 education markets. The company was founded in 1984 and is headquartered in Buffalo Grove, Illinois. As of November 9, 2007, ASAP Software Express, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Dell Inc.

Show More

Company Highlights:

Surgient, Inc. offers self-service virtualization automation and lab management solutions. The company offers Virtual Automation Platform, a software automation and management platform that helps enterprise IT organizations to provide self-service computing resources to users. Its virtualization solutions are used for software QA/test, training, sales, and marketing applications. The company's Surgient Cloud Express combines cloud computing technology and implementation services to help organizations deploy on-premise clouds. Surgient also provides services, such as solution design and architecture, capacity and infrastructure planning, image and lab configuration planning, software installation and configuration, setup of initial images and lab configurations, software customization and integration, training for administrators and end-users, and custom reporting and analytics. The company serves hotels/hospitality, pharmaceutical, aerospace, insurance, software, financial services, healthcare, telecom, and hardware markets. Surgient, Inc. was formerly known as Surgient Networks, Inc. The company was founded in 1999 and is headquartered in Austin, Texas.

Show More

Company Highlights:

Interlink Group, Inc. operates as a consulting firm that provides e-business and network solutions. It provides technology solutions that assist business operations run securely to the front-end systems that interface with employees, customers, partners, and remote workers to connect them with the business. It specializes in application development, IT infrastructure, enterprise integration, enterprise content management and customer relationship management for Microsoft environments. The company's solutions include software methodology, network methodology, and project management. Interlink was founded in 1989 and is based in Englewood, Colorado with additional offices in Bellevue, Washington; San Francisco, California; Portland, Oregon; and Pune, India.

Show More

Company Highlights:

Transaction Applications Group, Inc. provides back office administrative and technical support solutions to life, health, and annuity providers in the insurance industry. It offers administrative solutions for new businesses that include application entry, editing, and changes; underwriting; policy printing; and policy assembly, quality checking, and mailing. The company s policyholder services include policy changes, contract administration, policy reissue and reinstatement, interest rates, annual statements, and notices to policy owners. It also offers commission services, including commission processing and payment, agent hierarchies, commissions reporting, and commissions accounting services; and general accounting and claims administration services. The company s technical solutions include LifeSys, a policy administration software platform; and Underwriter Workdesk, a workflow and case management tool. The company was founded in 1988 and is based in Lincoln, Nebraska. As of October 18, 2005, Transaction Applications Group, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Dell Inc.

Show More

Company Highlights:

QSS Group, Inc., an information technology (IT) services company, provides products and services for federal government clients and IT enterprises. It offers IT enterprise consulting solutions that include enterprise architecture, e-government solutions, technology planning and assessment, enterprise integration services, and data and systems interoperability; and infrastructure services, such as network design and integration, network upgrades, LAN/WAN administration, electronic mail services and support, data center and facility operations, business continuity/disaster recovery, and network operation centers. The company also provides end-user services, including help desk/call center services, problem management, break/fix and maintenance, and asset management; application development and implementation services, such as software development life cycle services and support, database design and implementation, Web design and Web-enabled system development, legacy migrations, COTS integration, and software quality assurance and configuration management; and information assurance services, including PKI implementation, security and access control systems, multi-platform account management, authentication, and smart card implementation. In addition, it offers IT services for space applications, data and information systems, aeronautic applications, scientific applications, and computational sciences. Further, the company provides IT services for intelligence systems, infrastructure services, and system security design and engineering. The company was founded in 1994 and is based in Lanham, Maryland. It has locations in the United States, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, and the Netherlands. QSS Group, Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Dell Inc.

Show More
